scenarioDescription:
The HD 1397 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 1397 is a star with 1.32 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.34 times its radius. It is located 259.52 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.51 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 1397 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 1397 system


HD 1397 b

HD 1397 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2019-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 1397 b is 131.970 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 1397 b is 11.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 1397 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 1397, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: HD 1397 - System With 1 Exoplanet
